g.text: To investigate the effect of calcination temperature
on PL emission, the PL emission spectra of the sam-
ples at different calcination temperatures are tested
a. As seen in the inset, the sam-
ples sintered at 600 °C and 800 °C only show the red
emission peak centered at 617 nm which is attributed
]. As the sintering temperature increases, the
red emission peak becomes weak gradually and the
green emission peak (centered at 523 nm) is obviously
observed. Especially, the sample prepared at 1400 °C
mainly shows a typical characteristic Eu
centered at 523 nm, which is due to the 4f
]. By comparing the different PL curves

sintered temperature. This result coincides with that

tra of the sample sintered at 1400 °C. It can be found

sion with the illumination of a 365-nm UV lamp. The
b is consistent with the color
In order to further investigate the oxidation state of Eu
element, the XPS pattern of Eu3d for the sample obtained
at 1400 °C is monitored and shown in Fig.
cated at 1165 eV and 1135 eV are corresponded to Eu
oxidation state, but the peaks around 1155 eV and 1125
sult shows that some of the Eu
ions in the zeolite host under high-thermal treatment re-
